constraints_details.constraints_layer_description: KEYACH Name: Hogsmill Valley Key Area of Change
AIRCZ Type:: Gatwick Airport Wind Turbine Consultation Zone:Contact: The Safeguarding Department, Gatwick Airport Limited, 7th Floor Destinations Place, London Gatwick Airport, West Sussex, RH06 0NP

site_name: 127 Chiltern Drive And Chiltern Works SurbitonKT5 8LS
decision_conditions: The applicant has failed to demonstrate through the submission of sound evidence and rigorous marketing that there is no quantitative or qualitative demand for the use of site for light industrial purposes, or a range of alternative employment uses. The net loss of employment capacity (floorspace and/or land) on the site has not been justified and would be contrary to Policies C12 and DM17 of the Kingston Core Strategy (2012), Policies E2, E4 and E7 of the London Plan (2021) and the NPPF (2021).

The proposed development would not provide any affordable housing, contrary to Policies H4 and H5 of the London Plan (2021), Policy DM15 of the Kingston Core Strategy (2012) and is in conflict with the findings of the Independent Viability Assessor who has concluded that affordable dwellings could viably be provided on site. As such, the proposed development would fail to provide the maximum amount of affordable housing.

The applicant has failed to robustly demonstrate that the site is unsuitable to provide a minimum of 30% of dwellings as 3 or more bedroom units and no robust arguments or evidence have been submitted to demonstrate that a policy compliant provision of 3 or more bedroom units would be unviable. The proposed development would fail to contribute towards meeting the objectively assessed need within the Borough for 3 or more bedroom units. The proposed development is therefore contrary to Policy DM13 of the Kingston Core Strategy (2012).

It has not been demonstrated that the original ecological survey carried out in June 2019 remains valid and no Badger Surveys have been submitted. It has therefore not been robustly demonstrated that the proposed development would not adversely impact protected species, contrary to Policy G6 of the London Plan (2021), Policy DM6 of the Kingston Core Strategy (2012), the NPPF (2021), the Wildlife and Countryside Act 1981 (as amended) and The Protection of Badgers Act (1992).

The applicant has failed to submit a Fire Statement. It has therefore not been demonstrated that the proposed development would achieve the highest standards of fire safety, contrary to Policy D12 of the London Plan (2021).

It has not been robustly demonstrated that the proposed development would provide the maximum carbon reductions possible on site and no legal agreement has been submitted to secure an appropriate carbon offset financial contribution. No robust justification has been submitted to demonstrate that an Urban Greening Factor of at least 0.4 cannot be achieved on site. The proposed development is therefore contrary to Policies G5 and SI 2 of the London Plan (2021).

The proposed development would have a suboptimal site layout which would prioritise the car and would fail to achieve a high quality of design and would cause harm to the character and appearance of the surrounding area, contrary to Policies D4, D5 and D6 of the London Plan (2021) and Policies CS8 and DM10 of the Kingston Core Strategy (2012).
description: Mixed use development including retention of 127 Chiltern Drive, demolition of all other buildings and erection of 2no. buildings for flexible commercial floorspace at ground floor and residential accommodation on upper floors, with associated access, landscaping, car parking, cycle parking and refuse storage.
